qas.question: How many students attended the Bronx public noncharter schools as of 2000?
How many students attended the Bronx public and private schools as of 2000?
Which religious organizations run private schools in the Bronx?

answers.text: the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York and Jewish organizations

qas.question: Which entity runs the Bronx's public noncharter schools?

answers.text: The New York City Department of Education

context: Education in the Bronx is provided by a large number of public and private institutions, many of which draw students who live beyond the Bronx. <a3_0>The New York City Department of Education<a3_0/> manages public noncharter schools in the borough. In 2000, public schools enrolled <a0_0>nearly 280,000<a0_0/> of the Bronx's residents over 3 years old (out of <a1_0>333,100<a1_0/> enrolled in all pre-college schools). There are also several public charter schools. Private schools range from élite independent schools to religiously affiliated schools run by <a2_0>the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York and Jewish organizations<a2_0/>.
